paragraph.heading: 1Layout Constructor
paragraph.paragraph:
The layout constructor provides a view of the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#object objects you have defined in your system, in which the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#object objects may be manipulated.

Each item in the tree represents one object. The screenshot above represents the following
/libraries/vision2/00_introduction EiffelVision2 interface definition - An EV_TITLED_WINDOW containing one child, of type EV_VERTICAL_BOX. Within the vertical box there is an EV_HORIZONTAL_BOX and an EV_LIST. The list is empty, but the horizontal box contains three different objects of type EV_BUTTON.

The information displayed, only shows you the structure of the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#object objects , and although it gives you an indication of the final appearance of the interface you are building, you cannot see the details of the interface. i.e. color, sizes, tool tips etc.

All
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#object objects displayed in here are
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#pick_and_drop pickable , so can be easily manipulated, e.g.
/tools/eiffelbuild/how_to_s/30_delete_an_object/index deleted or
/tools/eiffelbuild/how_to_s/50_reparent_an_object/index reparented .
paragraph.note:
Note: If the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#object object in the tree has the Name property set, then the text corresponds to the name, otherwise, the text is the type of the
/tools/eiffelbuild/reference/02_notation.html#object object .
paragraph.paragraph:
If you have just started a new project, then the layout constructor will only contain one tree item, TITLED_WINDOW.
2Expanding/Collapsing
To Expand all of the items displayed in the layout constructor, select Expand layout tree from the View menu.
Similarly, if you wish to collapse all of the items in the layout constructor, select Collapse layout tree from the View menu.
